issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Cloudformation stack name should only allow alphanumeric characters

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: *Assessment* When using defining a long alphanumeric name (less than the 255 character restriction) for a Cloudformation stack, the following error is returned: {code} # echo fields.summary: Creating Cloudformation Stack with alphanumeric name less than 255 characters returns an odd error

comments.body: Currently we only allow for a stack identifier of 255 characters. The stack identifier is the name plus another ~80 characters, so a name longer than ~175 characters will fail with this error.

Stacks with long names can now be created. Errors still occur when trying to create some resources as (for example) the stack identifier is used as a tag value and exceeds the maximum permitted length.

Fix Verified

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.1.0
Release     : 0.0.22958.317.20150108git00561e8.el6

Stack names up to the limit are accepted. Be careful though, as [~sjones] mentioned, stack can still fail because tags or names for resources created may exceed limits of those resources. These include but are not limited to bucket names, volume tags etc that are generated.
